CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert Licker, housewife, Glenshaw and Fletcher Boyd, Washington, D.C., were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 18, 1962, pg. 5 with question: "What's America's biggest problem today?"  Mrs. Licker's answer reads: "There are so many things today.  I really couldn't say which problem is the greatest."  Mr. Boyd's answer reads: "You know the biggest problem - the problem of discrimination."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. Robert Licker wearing floral and circular patterned dress, standing in front of store advertising Franklin Sugar, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Fletcher Boyd wearing light colored short sleeved shirt with eyeglasses case in breast pocket, standing in front of building, Smithfield Street, Downtown
